title: Islamic art sale fields record telephone bids from Middle Eastern, European and American clients
text:
Last week’s Islamic art sales in London performed valiantly considering the political turmoil in the Middle East.

One of the highlights was the Najd collection of Orientalist paintings which the Telegraph revealed had been assembled by Saudi billionaire Nasser Al-Rashid in the 1970s and 80s.

A packed salesroom watched as auctioneer Mark Poltimore fielded record telephone bids from Middle Eastern, European and American clients.

The top among them was the £4.3m paid for Austrian artist, Ludwig Deutsch’s painstakingly realistic depiction of elaborately dressed figures approaching the armed Nubian guard of a temple entrance. The painting last sold in 1977 for £17,000.

The Telegraph also revealed...
description: Last week’s Islamic art sales in London performed valiantly considering the political turmoil in the Middle East.
